channel.title: Where do you draw the line?
channel.description:
If you guys haven't seen the North Korean "Dream" video I advise you go watch it:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9FbmmsDYObU
And here is an article on it: http://news.yahoo.com/blogs/lookout/north-korea-dream-video-us-missile-attack-140005920.html
As for tl;dr :
Basically a korean kid is dreaming about a nuclear bomb being dropped on NYC. This was created by North Korean government and posted on their official youtube channel. So my question is.. Is this too far? Should we be scared/ What implications will it have down the road?

item.title: Where do you draw the line?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Bowser jr:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,599965.0.html

anti-american propaganda set to the tune of a song from an american artist, with stolen video footage﻿ of an american game, hosted on a video sharing site originated from america

Read full topic

item.title: Where do you draw the line?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:11, topic:482048”]http://www.nuclearsecrecy.com/nukemap/?lat=40.72307714193102&lng=-73.99494647977843&zm=11&kt=340
If they somehow had some really big nukes.
But most likely:
http://www.nuclearsecrecy.com/nukemap/?lat=40.72307714193102&lng=-73.99494647977843&zm=11&kt=10[/quote]
The damage area is a lot smaller than I thought. It’s still a decent chunk though.

Read full topic
item.source: Where do you draw the line?

item.title: Where do you draw the line?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

nuclearsecrecy.com

NUKEMAP by Alex Wellerstein

NUKEMAP is a Google Maps mash-up that calculates the effects of the detonation of a nuclear bomb.


If they somehow had some really big nukes.
But most likely:

item.title: Where do you draw the line?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:9, topic:482048”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=600288.msg4216468#msg4216468 date=1360348313]
jal and tsu: You are overestimating the power of nukes. A nuke isn’t a doomsday machine in it self, and the ones DPRK have is pretty weak.
[/quote]
Say they actually DID send it our way and it landed in NYC. Whats the radius, in miles, that you think it would cover?[/quote]Over 9000

Read full topic

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:5, topic:482048”]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,599965.0.html

How can you hate this video, the music is so catchy.

It can’t be more American than this without adding a bunch of eagles.[/quote]They should make the bomb in the shape of an eagle or at least paint it with eagles and american flags.

item.source: Where do you draw the line?

item.title: Where do you draw the line?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

tskuasa:

Ya I agree with you… Especially since I am <60 miles (in blast radius) of NYC.

Im not incredibly smart or anything but Im pretty sure a nuclear would take out more than a couple states. Im in MO and if it was dropped in NYC I would probably feel a little bit of it.

IMO I think its bullcrap how religion is brought into politics which is the core reason of why nobody can get along(talking about governments) If everyone did their job without trying to shove a bomb up their neighbors ass then we wouldnt have anything to worry about.
It reminds me of little fucking school girls that spy on their enemy until they do something wrong so they can run to the teacher and tattle just to watch them get disciplined.
There is my rant for the day lol

Read full topic
item.source: Where do you draw the line?
